cs1302.calc

Class BasicMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs1302.calc.BasicMath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Math

    public class BasicMath
extends java.lang.Object
implements Math
    Provides a basic implementation of the operations defined in the Math interface. This implementation assumes that the inputs to each method are non-negative integers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicMath() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int add(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary addition operation lhs + rhs.
      int div(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary division operation lhs / rhs.
      int fac(int num)
      Returns the result of the unary factorial operation num !.
      int lshift(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary left-shift operation lhs << rhs.
      int mul(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary multiplication operation lhs * rhs.
      int pow(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary exponentiation operation lhs ^ rhs.
      int rshift(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary right-shift operation lhs >> rhs.
      int sub(int lhs, int rhs)
      Returns the result of the binary subtraction operation lhs - rhs.

        public int add(int lhs,
               int rhs)
        Description copied from interface: Math
        Returns the result of the binary addition operation lhs + rhs.

        The default implementation does not need to be overrident in implementing classes.

      • div

        public int div(int lhs,
               int rhs)
        throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Description copied from interface: Math
        Returns the result of the binary division operation lhs / rhs. This method should throw a ArithmeticException if the second operand is equal to zero.
        Specified by:

        rhs - the second operand
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • pow

        public int pow(int lhs,
               int rhs)
        Description copied from interface: Math
        Returns the result of the binary exponentiation operation lhs ^ rhs. Please note that this is not equivalent to the ^ operator in Java, which represents the bitwise exclusive-or.
